result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald Scott Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronald Scott Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ronald Scott Jr. was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Ronald Scott Jr. was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Ronald Scott Jr. was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Count 1 in case 22CM377/Count 3 in case 22CM899 but concurrent to Count 2 in cases 22CM377/22CM899/22CM94.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.

supervisions.notes:
Same as Count 3.
Concurrent to Counts 3 & 5.

Same as Count 3.
Concurrent to Counts 3 & 4.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Scott Jr.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

02:23 PM  State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant, Ronald Scott, appeared with Attorney J. Eric Olson.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM899/22CM898/22CM377/22CM319/22CM94/22TR1990-22TR1986.   Victim rights compliance. Attorney Olson places the agreement on the record.  

22CM899:  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to counts 2 and 3; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, counts 1, 4 and 5 are dismissed.
Count 2-Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions; consecutive to count 1 in Case 22CM377/count 3 in Case 22CM899, but concurrent to count 2 in Case 22CM377/22CM899/22CM94. 
Count 3-Court imposes sentence of 30 days jail (no Huber privileges); credit for 4 days served; deft to report to jail on 8/27/22 at 8am. Consecutive to count 1 in Case 22CM377.

22CM898: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to counts 1 and 3; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, counts 2 and 4-7 are dismissed. 
Counts 1 and 3- Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions; consecutive to count 1 in Case 22CM377/count 3 in Case 22CM899, but concurrent to count 2 in Case 22CM377/22CM899/22CM94. 

22CM377: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1 and 4; found guilty by the court.  On State's motion, 2, 3 and 5 are dismissed and read in. 
Count 1- Court imposes sentence of 30 days jail (no Huber privileges); credit for 9 days served; deft to report to jail on 8/27/22 at 8am; $350 fine plus costs; pay DNA surcharge; pay prosecution costs (by stipulation of deft); 12 months revocation of DL; IID; OWI assessment.
Count 4- Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions; credit for 4 days served; consecutive to count 1 in Case 22CM377 and concurrent to count 2 in Case 22CM377/22CM899/22CM94. 

22CM319: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to counts 3-5; found guilty by the court.  On State's motion, counts 1, 2 and 6 are dismissed. 
Counts 3, 4 and 5- Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions; consecutive to count 1 in Case 22CM377/count 3 in Case 22CM899, but concurrent to count 2 in Case 22CM377/22CM899/22CM94. 

22CM94: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to counts 1 and 2; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, count 3 is dismissed.
Count 1 and 2- Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions; consecutive to count 1 in Case 22CM377/count 3 in Case 22CM899, but concurrent to count 2 in Case 22CM377/22CM899/22CM94. 

*Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant in Case 22CM377.

22TR1990-22TR1986: On State's motion files 22TR1990-1986 are dismissed.

09:40 AM   State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant, Ronald Scott, appeared with Attorney J. Eric Olson.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM899/22CM898/22CM377/22CM319/22CM94: Attorney Olson advised the Court that these matters are resolved. Due to calendar congestion the Court will adjourn and schedule a plea hearing.

22TR1990-22TR1986: These matters continue to trail 22CM94.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber. Attorney J. Eric Olson in court with Defendant Ronald Scott.  Clerk: PT
  Atty Olson states he just got appointed DE's new file 22CM377 and requests an adjournment for further resolution; no objection by the State.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:36 AM
Defendant, Ronald Scott, appeared in court.
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
22CM94, 22CM319, 22CM377, 22TR1986-22TR1990:
Atty Olson is tied up in Br 3.
Matter set over, bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 10:45 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Weapons especially Firearms.  No drug paraphenalia.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License or a properly installed and operating IID if required

02:15 PM  
  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 08:30 am. w/ other cases 22CM94.  $1000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).    jk
